title: What will happen on earth in 2050? - Quora

response.answer_text: You are wondering what the Earth will be like in 2050. But you don't want to wait. Being the physicist that you are, you step into your time machine, set for a long, long journey. The machine is accelerating. Warping Space-Time fabric. And there you are! 2050. The year 2050. The time machine shows the red sign, signaling unsafe to get out here. You camp, in a nice, pressurized, oxygenated and radiation free environment. A week passes by…. You're still wondering what's the problem. You check the GPS and, “Oh holy shit. Good thing my time machine is radiation free.” You were in the CHERNOBYL EXCLUSION ZONE You turn your machine to “Travel mode” and take off, looking for a safe place. You open the world political map and that was NOT what you expected. NOT AT ALL. India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan and Nepal merged to form “Indian Subcontinent”. USA, Canada, Russia and Switzerland have formed the “ United Countries of America and Asia”. China, Mongolia, Kazakhstan, the Koreas, Japan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan are now “Middle Asia”. Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Oman, Kuwait, Qatar have formed “ Islamic Union” Africa, Netherlands, Greenland have formed the “Union Overseas Republic” Australia and the bajillion other Islands are now “The republic of Oceania”. The carribean and all the countries from South America are now “South Earth” The only independent country is Madagascar. When you clicked “ more info”, its just like the movie Madagascar. There's a small island near the 0°,0° coordinates. That's Disney world. Like, everything that happens in Disney, is here for real. You think visiting everywhere individually will be a real pain, so you decide to just open up Quora instead. “Why did Sockistan fall apart?” “Why is Trump making a wall over the great wall of China?” “What happened to the algebra of 33 years before?” “What is the history of Donald Trump? Why is he all over our history textbooks?” “Who is this Mohd Sufyan guy? I read about him on Wikipedia. Any ideas?” “What is 1+1?” “Why can't we find a general formula for 135 degree polynomials? The other 134 were no problem?” “What happened to-” And you stop in your path. There has been three whole countries missing on the map. Iran, Iraq, Syria. What happened? You open the question, and read: “Sockistan drowned them. In 2033, the world had complete unity against the chaos these three guys have been causing, and we drowned them for world piece, and then politically broke up. Hope they find Atlantis.” And you feel like the God. You weren't watching while flying and now can see deep space. Now you are fixed in place. You look through the telescope at 800x towards Mars. “Ha! That for sure looks like-- a civilisation?” You fly. Fly at 0.999997c towards mars. You barely miss the moon as wild thoughts run in your mind. “Mars has life? That can't be humans. That just Can't be humans.” You are wondering as you set your journey towards the red planet. Who knows who, or what awaits…  This is the end, at least for now. I'll extend the story as soon as I get the time. But for now, I've got middle school stuff to deal with. Thanks for reading. Once I reach 10 upvotes, I guarantee, I'll edit. (If I get the time before that, I will, too)

The future is bright in my opinion, I believe technology will have some forms of new inventions but almost all of the time it costs money, so maybe new technology will come out then but it won’t hit for another 50 years until it has been funded. For example most technology from the 60’s–80’s is finally mainstream, like flat screen TV’s were invented a long time ago but a tablet sized screen costed about 500k 40 years ago. So really it’s the technology that is coming out today that will go mainstream. I think self driving cars like Tesla’s auto pilot will be very hot then and they will be very developed. A new technology that people really take for granted today is AirPods, wireless headphones that you can tap and ask Siri a question while not even looking at your phone is crazy. Without stopping your work you can ask any question that google can answer. With the way technology booming today wireless headphones could be the norm or even old tech 30 years from now. I don’t think we will break the barrier of putting any technology into your body. I’m being very conservative though, most predictions are unrealistic in my opinion, they are very optimistic. I think that 30 years from now we will still have domestic terrorism, hopefully we are out of the Middle East but honestly we could still be there. One field that will have an extreme boom will be gaming, I think that Virtual reality will be so easy to use, small, and very realistic. It’s one of the fastest moving industries and the limits are expanding so fast everyday.

Its a bright day in 2050 I’m passionate about technology that helps us in our everyday lives and makes us more socially connected. For example, today I got up early to get ready for work. I don’t need an alarm clock anymore because the new bio-metric chip I had installed in my body sends signals to my brain to gently wake me up. Not only that, the chip helps my brain learn things, remember better, and is connected to the new 10G network. I also love my contact lenses . These lenses are connected to the chip . After I said goodbye to my family, I put on my jetpack. I live still live in a small city so my jetpack is the perfect vehicle for traveling to work, which is only a few kilometers away. That’s an incredible progress. In short life in 2050 will be way more convenient and suitable for lazy people like me and there are too many awesome things one can imagine for the upcoming years of world.

Automation will fundamentally shift employment opportunities, and job security will reduce for most people. Environmental degradation will continue to escalate. Methane releases from permafrost will accelerate climate change effects. Inequality will continue to increase. China will continue to assert itself with a view to becoming the dominant force/nation/economy. Conflict will likely increase, if not move to all out war. In short - dystopia !

Not too much different, but a lot of species of plants and animals will have moved farther away from the equator as a result of global warming. There will also be more extreme droughts and storms, which will affect life on earth a bit.

Controlled like never before! It will not be the fittest surving but the richer and powerful will. There will be slavery like never seen before but in a different form. Genocides will also be a normal occurrence. All religions will be outlawed. All moral ethics will change just to benefit a few! I certainly am glad I won’t be around!
